verses.roman:
teṣāṁ vīrya-madāndhānāṁ
dṛptānāṁ smaya-nuttaye
ānitāsi mayā bhadre
tejopaharatāsatām

synonyms: teṣām—of them; vīrya—with their power; mada—by the intoxication; andhānām—blinded; dṛptānām—proud; smaya—the arrogance; nuttaye—to dispel; ānitā asi—you were taken in marriage; mayā—by Me; bhadre—good woman; tejaḥ—the strength; upaharatā—removing; asatām—of the wicked.
translation: It was to dispel the arrogance of these kings that I carried you away, My good woman, for they were blinded by the intoxication of power. My purpose was to curb the strength of the wicked.
